intro: Dumartroya fagifolia, commonly known as the Fagifolia tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
